53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (01:23): and my mp3s are on a fileserver with a 73GB U160 SCSI hard drive
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (01:24): and I still have space to spare on my workstation with the aforementioned list of things installed.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (01:24): enough to set aside a 10GB slice for live upgrade.

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (04:22): I'm in a small US development group for a sprawling multinational manufacturing firm... we develop certain core software used in our manufacturing applications.   this stuff is deployed all over the world in screwy ways, and we don't have a complete handle on every deployment.     we don't actually KNOW if there are still any 2.6 boxes in use, but suspect there may well be.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (04:23): if someone comes to us needing a bugfix, and we say they need to upgrade their server, it will get ugly.
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (04:23): call up microsoft and ask them to ship you a copy of window 3.11 (which would have been the current OS when sol2.6 was released) and see how far you get
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (04:23): 1998?  try again.  NT 4.0 had been out for a year.
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (04:23): 2.6 was first released in 94 or 95 from memory
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (04:23): and you can, last I heard, still download service packs for win98 and NT4
daa08b04a71644cbce3e6e7e5aeeb58e (04:24): peerce, if this was as big of an issue as you make it your sales rep can get you a copy
